title: 1.4.10 panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 1.4.10-stable-5f55d95a
OS & Version: Linux
#### Expected behaviour

Process blocks without crashing
#### Actual behaviour

Panic and crash while processing block 1942590
#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Not reproducible in a reliable way.
#### Backtrace

```
I0724 07:24:08.935221 core/blockchain.go:963] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 26 txs in 39.629619ms. #1942588 [050d62bb / 050d62bb]

panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
```

It happened again today. Same back trace. Since the log indicates it may have something do to with logs/filters, is there a way to remove all filters from a geth instance?
We are investigating this issue and will report back shortly. There is no way to remove all filters, the crash is triggered by a call to the eth_getLogs API method.
Ok, thank you. As an additional pointer, I'm not using the `eth_getFilterLogs` call, but `eth_getLogs` frequently.
